p: To determine whether the IRE-XBP1 pathway is activated in response to ZIKV infection in human neural cells, xbp1s was detected via RT-PCR. Similar to that induced by tunicamycin, the spliced xbp1s was detected at 24 and 48 hpi. The ratios of xbp1s/t- xbp1 between mock and ZIKV infection were 15.8-fold (24 hpi) and 32.6-fold (48 hpi) in CCF-STTG1 cells, and 3.1-fold (24 hpi) and 10.9-fold (48 hpi) in SK-N-SH cells (Fig. 5a, b). RT-qPCR results indicated that xbp1s significantly increased during ZIKV infection. It implied that ZIKV infection induced the splicing of xbp1.
